user_request: A poem for Valentine's Day about true love lasting forever.
final_poem:
Through centuries' spin, where time's wheel turns,  
A heartbeat's echo, steady, pure—  
Two souls entwined in dawn's first light,  
A fire that outlives the dying star.  

Oak roots entwine where wildflowers dare,  
Their whispers etched in every ring,  
Seasons may fade, yet your gaze remains,  
A constellation fixed in my sky.  

The tides may shift, the mountains groan,  
But here, in this moment, we are bound—  
A symphony of breath, of touch, of trust,  
A love that blooms beyond the grave's dark door.  

So let the years unravel, let the world decay—  
Our hands will hold what time cannot take.  
True love, once found, is never lost—  
It waits, eternal, in the heart's deep lake.
